articles.title: S. Korean Forces' War Exercises Flayed--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korean Forces' War Exercises Flayed--Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The puppet warmongers of south Korea staged a large-scale joint air rehearsal in the sky above the west of the Korean Peninsula from May 23 to 27 together with the U.S. air forces in south Korea.
					 Involved in this anti-DPRK rehearsal were more than 50 aerial warplanes and nuclear preemptive attack means.
					
					 Commenting on this fact, a news analyst of Rodong Sinmun Sunday says:
					
					 The rehearsal was very provocative and dangerous in content and nature as it was conducted in way of setting up "enemy formations" and then "repelling" someone's "provocation for overall war" with big offensive formations and dropping strategic bombs on main ground targets. 
					
					 It was a vivid expression of the scheme to mount preemptive attack on the DPRK and a reckless military provocation aimed to escalate the tension on the peninsula and spark off a war of aggression on the DPRK. 
					
					 The puppet forces are now escalating grave military provocation to the DPRK as never before in the West Sea of Korea under the signboard of "threat from the north" and staging almost every day anti-DPRK war games in the western area of the Military Demarcation Line.
					
					 Especially, naval firing exercises and war confabs against the DPRK are going on one after another in and around the five islands in the territorial waters of the DPRK on the West Sea of Korea. And big south Korea-U.S. joint marines rehearsal is to be staged around Paekryong Island in July for the first time of its kind.
					
					 The puppet forces have recently got hell-bent on setting up of trial "command for defense of northwest islands", calling for "defense reform" the keynote of which is to "strengthen joint action" of the three services and the marine corps. Accordingly, the madcap war games in the western region are a blatant challenge and provocation to the DPRK which is making every possible effort for the improvement of the north-south relations and peace of the country.
					
					 We love peace, but will mete out merciless and strong punishment to those seeking do harm to it. We never make an empty talk.

articles.title: S. Korea to Stage More War Maneuvers
articles.content:
S. Korea to Stage More War Maneuvers 
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet Joint Chiefs of Staff announced that military exercises codenamed Taeguk would be staged in three days from May 30, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The warmongers declared that in the exercises they would apply the program on reformed commanding structure, keynote of which is to vest chiefs of general staff of the services under the Joint Chiefs of Staff with the right to command operations, for the first time and confirm its efficiency.
					
					 Meanwhile, a unit of the puppet ground force on May 26 staged a drill for infiltrating into operation area after parachuting by helicopters in the area of Mahyon-ri, Kunnam-myon, Cholwon County, south Korean Kangwon Province.
					
					 Earlier on May 25 those of the puppet Defense Ministry, the Joint Chiefs of Staff and the Chemical, Biological and Radioactive Protection Command started a drill for countering biological terrorism and disaster for the first time in history under the supervision of the U.S. Forces Command present in south Korea.

articles.title: Defoliant Developed by US Was for Korean Warâ€”Document
articles.content:
Defoliant Developed by US Was for Korean War--Document
						
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. developed defoliant for use in the last Korean War, south Korean MBC reported.
					 This fact was exposed in a report worked out by an American expert in defoliant at the request of the U.S. Department of Defense in 2006.
					
					 He said that in 1952 when the war was at its height the U.S. Department of Defense developed defoliant for the purpose of using it in the real war and equipment for spraying it in the air.
					
					 Defoliant was used in the Demilitarized Zone of south Korea for the military purposes except the areas of Southeast Asia, and defoliant contained in 7,800 drums was sprayed under the agreement between the U.S. and the south Korean authorities in the late 1960s, he noted.

articles.title: Thoroughgoing Survey into US Military Bases Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Thoroughgoing Survey into US Military Bases Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Opposition parties of south Korea condemned the U.S. forces present in south Korea for trying to conceal the truth about their burial of defoliant.
					 A spokesman for the Democratic Party in a briefing on May 25 said that the U.S. forces' burial of defoliant increases anxiety of the people but the U.S. forces are taking irresponsible attitude, claiming that they will examine documents first of all.
					
					 Such attitude can never be allowed, he said, demanding that a thoroughgoing survey be made into not only the burial places in Chilgok and Puchon but all other U.S. military bases.
					
					 A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party in a commentary on the same day charged that a joint fact-finding group on May 23 made a superficial inspection of only the places, conducted by the U.S. forces, under their watch. He stressed the need to make a substantial investigation into the truth to thoroughly probe all the U.S. military bases.
					
					 That day the Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society released a commentary urging an overall open survey into the U.S. military bases in south Korea.
					
					 The people's discontent will never calm down unless a thoroughgoing probe into the burial of defoliant and open survey into the U.S. military bases are made, the commentary warned.

articles.title: S. Korea: Struggle for Implementation of North-South Declaration
articles.content:
S. Korea: Struggle for Implementation of North-South Declaration
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Members of the sit-in group for independent and peaceful reunification comprising reunification activists of south Korea staged a sit-in in Seoul on May 23 in demand of the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 They charged that the present regime has incited confrontation with fellow countrymen under the pretext of the "Cheonan" warship sinking case, thus further deteriorating the north-south relations and escalating the tension in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The present authorities should be well aware that what will be gained through north-south dialogue and cooperation is peace and reunification and what will be brought through tension and war is only ruin, they said.
					
					 They held that the present "government" should come out at an early date to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration which are beneficial to the south and the north and the way for realizing peaceful reunification.

articles.title: Military's Scheme to Introduce Attack Helicopters Flayed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Military's Scheme to Introduce Attack Helicopters Flayed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held the 112th rally for peace and disarmament outside the puppet Defense Ministry building on May 24.
					 At the rally speakers noted that the authorities have worked hard to purchase weapons for preemptive attack after taking the "May 24 step" under the pretext of the "Cheonan" warship case last year.
					
					 The ministry is single-handedly holding the closed-door negotiations to purchase new type helicopters from the U.S. Boeing Company, they charged.
					
					 To block such attempt is an important struggle for defusing the tension on the Korean Peninsula and for the life of workers and peasants who are undergoing economic sufferings, they said, calling upon the people from all walks of life to turn out in this struggle.
					
					 A written protest addressed to the puppet minister of Defense was read out at the rally.

articles.title: Defence of US Forces' Crimes Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Defence of US Forces' Crimes Censured in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea issued a statement on May 25 to denounce the candidate for puppet minister of Environment for defending the burial of defoliant by the U.S. forces present in south Korea.
					 The statement recalled that as regards the burial of defoliant the candidate on May 24 talked nonsense that the U.S. would have not done such deed even for the sake of its citizens.
					
					 When the people, enraged at the U.S. forces' deed, are demanding an immediate probe into the truth and responsible measures, the person in charge of the settlement of the issue is trying to protect the U.S. forces, a group of criminals, rather than the safety of the population and security of environment, the statement charged.
					
					 It is clear that the candidate will deceive the people while reading the U.S. face, it said, adding that she should be divested of candidate's license.

articles.title: Environment of Waegwan US Military Base in S. Korea Seriously Polluted
articles.content:
Environment of Waegwan US Military Base in S. Korea Seriously Polluted
						
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Environment has been seriously polluted in the U.S. military base in Waegwan, Chilgok County, North Kyongsang Province, south Korean MBC reported.
					 According to the analysis into underground water and soil in the base, carcinogenic substances more than 30 times the allowed level were detected.
					
					 Inhabitants of several hundred households around the base are reported to use this underground water for drinking and farming at present.

articles.title: Fascist Suppression of Workers Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Fascist Suppression of Workers Slammed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification in a commentary on May 24 denounced the Lee Myung Bak dictatorial regime for its violent crackdown on workers.
					 That day the authorities set in motion 2,500 policemen to arrest at least 500 workers of an enterprise who were staging a sit-in in protest against the unreasonable closure of workshop by the management side, the commentary noted.
					
					 The authorities' suppression is aimed to stamp out the rights of the workers and obliterate the labor movement, it said, warning that the "government's" repression will invite bigger resistance of the workers.

articles.title: Repeated Punishment on Reunification Champion in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repeated Punishment on Reunification Champion in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities on May 25 brought to court again Yun Ki Jin on charges of violation of the "National Security Law". Yun, co-chairman of the Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty, was released in late February.
					 That day the puppet Suwon District Court held a trial of Yun on charges of "praise and encouragement" under the NSL, branding 30 odd articles and letters written by him in prison as "enemy-benefiting".
					
					 Yun at the trial pointed to injustice of the indictment, contending that the letters and articles went through strict inspection by the authorities at that time.

articles.title: Songun Politics Praised by Costa Rican Party Leader
articles.content:
Songun Politics Praised by Costa Rican Party Leader
Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Humberto Vargas Carbonel, general secretary of the C.C., the People's Vanguard of Costa Rica, released a statement on May 21 on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of the start of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The Songun politics based on the Juche idea is a powerful political mode of the WPK, the statement said, adding:
					
					 Kim Jong Il, the peerlessly Songun brilliant commander, has strengthened the WPK into the invincible party guiding the revolution and construction to victory by taking hold on the Songun politics as the treasured sword of invincibility. 
					
					 The WPK has won victory after victory as the invincible party and the powerful party steering the world socialist movement. This is the brilliant fruition of the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Songun politics of the WPK led by Kim Jong Il is the most powerful political mode under socialism and the treasured sword for sure victory of the revolution.
					
					 The WPK will always emerge victorious under his experienced and tested leadership.

articles.title: Annual Meeting of Finnish Juche Idea Organization
articles.content:
Annual Meeting of Finnish Juche Idea Organization
						
Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- An annual general meeting of the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea was held in Helsinki on May 20.
					 The meeting reviewed the committee's activities for last year and discussed its action orientation for this year.
					
					 Juha Kieksy, chairman of the committee, said that the Juche idea has been recognized as the eternal guiding idea for the human cause of independence for its scientific accuracy, originality, great vitality and invincible might.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il is wisely leading socialist Korea with the original Songun politics, an embodiment of the Juche idea, the chairman said, adding:
					
					 We will conduct the study and dissemination of the Juche idea on a wider scale.
					
					 We are sure that the Korean people will bring about a decisive turn in building a great prosperous and powerful nation and certainly achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Juche idea followers in Finland will fully support the Korean people's cause of justice.
					
					 The meeting adopted a statement in support of the decision of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea on holding a world conference on the Juche idea in Pyongyang on the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Swiss Internet Website
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Swiss Internet Website
						
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on May 21 posted on its Internet homepage the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Bring the Advantages of Socialism in Our Country into Full Play".
					 The work, published on May 24, 1990, comprehensively expounds the essence, main characteristics, invincibility and advantages of Korean-style socialism embodying the Juche idea. 
					
					 It specifies tasks arising in giving full play to the advantages of socialism in our country in all fields, carrying through the new five-point policy for national reunification and consistently implementing the foreign policy of the country--independence, peace and friendship--under the uplifted banner of socialism.

articles.title: China Accuses US Sanctions
articles.content:
China Accuses US Sanctions
 Beijing, May 27 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the Chinese Foreign Ministry in a press conference on May 26 accused the U.S. of its unilateral sanctions against China.
					 Recently the United States decided to impose sanctions on three companies of China, asserting that it had dealings with Iran, Syria and other countries over products or technologies which may be used in manufacturing mass destruction weapons and missiles.
					
					 In this regard the spokesperson declared that China rejects such sanctions imposed by the U.S. on the basis of its national law.

articles.title: Chinese Ship Captain Discloses Japan's Wrongs
articles.content:
Chinese Ship Captain Discloses Japan's Wrongs 
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- A Chinese trawler captain, in a recent interview with Ming Pao Daily News of Hong Kong, referred to the details about the case of collisions between his trawler and Japan's Coast Guard patrol boats in waters off the southern area of China in September last year. 
					 He said that the patrol boats out-sailed his trawler going to return after fishing and suddenly changed direction to strike it. 
					
					 After the collisions members of the Japan Coast Guard Agency went on board and clubbed and kicked the Chinese crew, he said, adding that they did not allow him to sleep after arresting.

articles.title: China Gives Importance to Development of Basic Research
articles.content:
China Gives Importance to Development of Basic Research 
						
Beijing, May 27 (KCNA) -- Chinese State Councilor Liu Yandong called for further development of basic research on Monday when speaking at a forum held China on basic research.
					Liu, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, called for more advanced equipment to improve scientific research, further reform in the system of science and technology, as well as cultivation of more innovative talents.
					
					She also stressed the need to push back the frontiers of latest science and technology on major sectors.

articles.title: "Network Force" Formed in China
articles.content:
"Network Force" Formed in China
 Beijing, May 27 (KCNA) -- The "network force" was formed in China, according to a spokesman for the Ministry of National Defence of China.
					 He said in a press conference on May 25 that its foundation by the Chinese People's Liberation Army is aimed to enhance the level of protecting network security of CPLA units on the basis of the requirement of training. 
					
					 The network security has become an international issue at present and is affecting not only social realms but also the military field, he noted. 
					
					 China, as a victim of attack on network, is paying attention to strengthening network security and protection, he said.

articles.title: Japan to Export Arms
articles.content:
Japan to Export Arms
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Japan is seeking to sell its military equipment to other countries.
					 The Japanese government recently decided to allow the export to a third country of naval interceptor missiles it is jointly developing with the U.S., according to the Kyodo News.

articles.title: Japanese Protest against US Nuclear Tests
articles.content:
Japanese Protest against US Nuclear Tests
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Various circles of Japan strongly protested against the U.S. tests of new-type nuclear weapon on May 23.
					 That day the mayor of Nagasaki submitted a written protest to the U.S. chief executive, in which he said that the tests are contrary to the expectation of many people aspiring after the world without nukes.
					
					 Meanwhile, five A-bomb victims organizations in Nagasaki Prefecture in a written protest submitted to the U.S. embassy in Tokyo said that any nuclear test by the U.S. is intolerable.

articles.title: Venezuela Condemns US Sanctions
articles.content:
Venezuela Condemns US Sanctions 
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The Venezuelan government condemned the U.S. sanctions on the country.
					 As regards the U.S. decision to impose sanctions on Venezuela's state oil company for doing business with Iran on May 24, Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez branded this as a new aggression act of the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					 He said it would serve only to strengthen Venezuela's resolve.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Venezuelan foreign minister in a statement said that "Venezuela reserves the most proper response to this imperialist aggression."
					
					 Venezuela intends to continue strengthening ties with the Iranian government, he added.

articles.title: Hezbollah Rejects US Assertion
articles.content:
Hezbollah Rejects US Assertion
Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The secretary general of the Lebanese Shiite armed group Hezbollah, speaking at a rally on May 25, lashed out at the U.S. unreasonable assertion.
					 Recently the present U.S. administration claimed that Hezbollah was behind the political assassinations in Lebanon and called for an international investigation into them.
					
					 "These accusations are baseless," he said, adding such remarks were aimed to appease Israel.
					
					 "They have left nothing for the Arabs but the choice of resistance," he said, stressing that Hezbollah would continue its struggle against Israel.

articles.title: Lithuania Rejects West's Sanctions on Belarus
articles.content:
Lithuania Rejects West's Sanctions on Belarus
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The Lithuanian president in a press conference on May 23 expressed the country's resolute stand against the European Union's economic sanctions on Belarus. 
					 Such sanctions may give a serious affect on the citizens of Belarus, the president said.

articles.title: NAM Foreign Ministerial Meeting in Indonesia
articles.content:
NAM Foreign Ministerial Meeting in Indonesia
						
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- A foreign ministerial meeting of Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) took place in Indonesia from May 25 to 27.
					 Present at the meeting, held timing to coincide with the 50th anniversary of NAM, were foreign ministers and high-ranking government delegates from at least 100 NAM member nations including the DPRK.
					
					 Its participants underlined the need for NAM member nations to unite and further enhance the role of NAM as leading force in the settlement of international issues.
					
					 They also stressed that NAM should play a core role in defending and consolidating the interests of developing countries and intensify the collective action of its member states.
					
					 The meeting approved the admission of Azerbaijan and Fiji to NAM and adopted the Bali declaration commemorating the 50th anniversary of NAM, its final document and others.

articles.title: More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- More NATO soldiers in Afghanistan met deaths due to the attack of the resistance forces of the country.
					 Two NATO soldiers were killed in the southern and northern regions on May 25.
					
					 More than 180 NATO soldiers have been killed in Afghanistan since the beginning of this year.
